docs.snippet: Alex Rodriguez will play his first game of the season at Yankee Stadium on Friday night and is likely to hear it from fans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez will play his first game of the season at Yankee Stadium on Friday night and is likely to hear it from fans.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell On Baseball column holds that when Alex Rodriguez, the not-yet-suspended-for-211-games man, returns for the first time in 2013 season to Yankee Stadium, he will hear a vast, swelling Bronx cheer.

docs.snippet: Max Scherzer became baseball’s first 17-game winner as the Detroit Tigers posted their 12th straight victory, routing the host Cleveland Indians, 10-3....
docs.lead_paragraph: Max Scherzer became baseball’s first 17-game winner as the Detroit Tigers posted their 12th straight victory, routing the host Cleveland Indians, 10-3.
docs.abstract: Detroit Tigers post their 12th straight victory, routing Cleveland Indians, 10-3; other baseball scores noted.

docs.snippet: Russell Martin’s pinch-hit single in the 10th inning lifted the host Pittsburgh Pirates over the Miami Marlins, 5-4, on Thursday for their fifth straight win....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russell Martin’s pinch-hit single in the 10th inning lifted the host Pittsburgh Pirates over the Miami Marlins, 5-4, on Thursday for their fifth straight win.

docs.snippet: Dillon Gee picked up where Matt Harvey left off, shutting down the Rockies and helping the Mets resume their quest for second place in the National League East....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dillon Gee picked up where Matt Harvey left off, shutting down the Rockies and helping the Mets resume their quest for second place in the National League East.
docs.abstract: New York Mets defeat Colorado Rockies, 2-1.

headline.main: Gee Helps Mets Finish Sweep and Rediscover Optimism
headline.print_headline: Gee Helps Mets Finish Sweep And Rediscover Optimism

docs.snippet: Alex Rodriguez said he wanted a positive welcome from the fans in his 2013 home debut....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez said he wanted a positive welcome from the fans in his 2013 home debut.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez says he wants positive welcome from fans at his 2013 home debut;  will also be his first game at home since Major League Baseball issued a 211-game suspension for using performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.main: Rodriguez Hoping for an Unlikely Reception

docs.snippet: A New York Times poll found 1 in 5 Yankees fans have a favorable opinion of Alex Rodriguez, and about twice as many view him unfavorably....
docs.lead_paragraph: A New York Times poll found 1 in 5 Yankees fans have a favorable opinion of Alex Rodriguez, and about twice as many view him unfavorably.
docs.abstract: New York Times poll finds that only 1 in 5 New York Yankees fans have a favorable opinion of Alex Rodriguez, and about twice as many view him unfavorably; analysis reveals that Rodriguez's unfavorable rating increased among Yankees fans as more became aware of doping allegations.

headline.main: A Poll by The Times Finds That Rodriguez Is Alienating Many Yankees Fans
headline.print_headline: A Poll by The Times Finds That Rodriguez Is Alienating Many Yankees Fans

docs.snippet: Fans have jeered and booed more than one Yankee on the field in the past, and scorching one of your own has been a phenomenon well-documented in other sports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fans have jeered and booed more than one Yankee on the field in the past, and scorching one of your own has been a phenomenon well-documented in other sports.
docs.abstract: Staff writers for the New York Times share memories of times when sports fans jeered and booed one of their own; same phenomenon is expected to be in place as Alex Rodriguez returns to put on New York Yankees uniform at home for first time in 2013 season.

docs.snippet: The reward for information leading to an arrest and conviction of those responsible for defacing a statue of Jackie Robinson in New York with swastikas and hate speech is now $50,000....
docs.lead_paragraph: The reward for information leading to an arrest and conviction of those responsible for defacing a statue of Jackie Robinson in New York with swastikas and hate speech is now $50,000.

headline.main: $50K Offered for Info in Defaced NY Statue
headline.print_headline: $50K Offered for Info in Defaced NY Statue

docs.snippet: The 10-date package provides programming for Fox Sports 1 and gives horse racing valuable exposure beyond the Triple Crown and the Breeders’ Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 10-date package provides programming for Fox Sports 1 and gives horse racing valuable exposure beyond the Triple Crown and the Breeders’ Cup.
docs.abstract: Fox Sports is getting into the horse racing business, entering a multiyear agreement with the Jockey Club to present prominent graded stakes races, beyond Triple Crown and Breeders' Cup, on television starting in 2014.

headline.main: Fox Sports Will Present Horse Racing Package
headline.print_headline: Fox Sports Will Present Horse Racing Package

docs.snippet: The online magazine Slate.com and two other publications have said they will no longer refer to the National Football League's Washington, D.C., football team as the "Redskins," a name Native Americans have condemned as offensive....
docs.lead_paragraph: The online magazine Slate.com and two other publications have said they will no longer refer to the National Football League's Washington, D.C., football team as the "Redskins," a name Native Americans have condemned as offensive.

headline.main: Slate.com, Others to Ban 'Redskins' Name From Their Pages
headline.print_headline: Slate.com, Others to Ban 'Redskins' Name From Their Pages
